PIC Code/SNTP Customised.c
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 @brief Custom version of SNTP
00002 /*********************************************************************
00003  *
00004  *      Simple Network Time Protocol (SNTP) Client Version 3
00005  *  Module for Microchip TCP/IP Stack
00006  *       -Locates an NTP Server from public site using DNS
00007  *       -Requests UTC time using SNTP and updates SNTPTime structure
00008  *        periodically, according to NTP_QUERY_INTERVAL value
00009  *      - Reference: RFC 1305
00010  *
00011  *********************************************************************
00012  * FileName:        SNTP.c
00013  * Dependencies:    UDP, ARP, DNS, Tick
00014  * Processor:       PIC18, PIC24F, PIC24H, dsPIC30F, dsPIC33F, PIC32
00015  * Compiler:        Microchip C32 v1.00 or higher
00016  *                                      Microchip C30 v3.01 or higher
00017  *                                      Microchip C18 v3.13 or higher
00018  *                                      HI-TECH PICC-18 STD 9.50PL3 or higher
00019  * Company:         Microchip Technology, Inc.
00020  *
00021  * Software License Agreement

00024  * reserved.

00030  *      integrated into Licensee's product; or

00032  *      ENC28J60.h ported to a non-Microchip device used in

00058 #define __SNTP_C

00067 /// Defines how frequently to resynchronize the date/time (default: 10 minutes)
00068 #define NTP_QUERY_INTERVAL              (10ull*60ull * TICK_SECOND)
00069 
00070 /// Defines how long to wait to retry an update after a failure.
00071 /// Updates may take up to 6 seconds to fail, so this 14 second delay is actually only an 8-second retry.
00072 #define NTP_FAST_QUERY_INTERVAL (14ull * TICK_SECOND)
00073 
00074 /// Port for contacting NTP servers
00075 #define NTP_SERVER_PORT                 (123ul)
00076 
00077 /// Reference Epoch to use.  (default: 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00)
00078 #define NTP_EPOCH                               (86400ul * (365ul * 70ul + 17ul))
00079 
00080 /// Defines how long to wait before assuming the require has failed
00081 #define NTP_REPLY_TIMEOUT               (6ul*TICK_SECOND)
00082 
00083 
00084 
00085 
00086 // These are normally available network time servers.
00087 // The actual IP returned from the pool will vary every
00088 // minute so as to spread the load around stratum 1 timeservers.
00089 // For best accuracy and network overhead you should locate the 
00090 // pool server closest to your geography, but it will still work
00091 // if you use the global pool.ntp.org address or choose the wrong 
00092 // one or ship your embedded device to another geography.
00093 //#define NTP_SERVER    "pool.ntp.org"
00094 //#define NTP_SERVER    "europe.pool.ntp.org"
00095 //#define NTP_SERVER    "asia.pool.ntp.org"
00096 //#define NTP_SERVER    "oceania.pool.ntp.org"
00097 //#define NTP_SERVER    "north-america.pool.ntp.org"
00098 //#define NTP_SERVER    "south-america.pool.ntp.org"
00099 //#define NTP_SERVER    "africa.pool.ntp.org"
00100 
00101 /// Defines the structure of an NTP packet
00102 typedef struct _NTP_PACKET
00103 {
00104         struct
00105         {
00106                 BYTE mode                       : 3;    ///< NTP mode
00107                 BYTE versionNumber      : 3;    ///< SNTP version number
00108                 BYTE leapIndicator      : 2;    ///< Leap second indicator
00109         } flags;                                                ///< Flags for the packet
00110 
00111         BYTE stratum;                                   ///< Stratum level of local clock
00112         CHAR poll;                                              ///< Poll interval
00113         CHAR precision;                                 ///< Precision (seconds to nearest power of 2)
00114         DWORD root_delay;                               ///< Root delay between local machine and server
00115         DWORD root_dispersion;                  ///< Root dispersion (maximum error)
00116         DWORD ref_identifier;                   ///< Reference clock identifier
00117         DWORD ref_ts_secs;                              ///< Reference timestamp (in seconds)
00118         DWORD ref_ts_fraq;                              ///< Reference timestamp (fractions)
00119         DWORD orig_ts_secs;                             ///< Origination timestamp (in seconds)
00120         DWORD orig_ts_fraq;                             ///< Origination timestamp (fractions)
00121         DWORD recv_ts_secs;                             ///< Time at which request arrived at sender (seconds)
00122         DWORD recv_ts_fraq;                             ///< Time at which request arrived at sender (fractions)
00123         DWORD tx_ts_secs;                               ///< Time at which request left sender (seconds)
00124         DWORD tx_ts_fraq;                               ///< Time at which request left sender (fractions)
00125 } NTP_PACKET;
00126 
00127 
00128 /// Seconds value obtained by last update
00129 DWORD dwSNTPSeconds = 0;
00130 
00131 /// Tick count of last update
00132 DWORD dwLastUpdateTick;
00133 
00134 /// stores the response from a SNTP test        
00135 int NTPTestResponse; 
00136 SNTPStates SNTPState;

00138 //******************************************************************************
00139 /// Prints the NTP server that if configured 
00140 void HTTPPrint_NTPServer (void) {
00141         
00142         TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, xPLConfig.NTP_Server, strlen(xPLConfig.NTP_Server));       
00143 }

00147 /// Prints Is AES active, if no then NTP is not enabled
00148 void HTTPPrint_AES_Active (void) {
00149 
00150         TCPPut(sktHTTP, (xPLConfig.Use_AES?'1':'0'));
00151 
00152 }

00156 /// Prints the last time update
00157 void HTTPPrint_NTPLastUpdate (void) {
00158 
00159 #if defined(STACK_USE_SNTP_CLIENT)
00160         char Tempdigit[12];
00161 
00162         uitoa(dwLastUpdateTick,   Tempdigit);
00163         TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, Tempdigit, strlen((char*)Tempdigit));      
00164 #endif
00165 }

00168 //******************************************************************************
00169 
00170 /// Prints the current EPOC
00171 void HTTPPrint_CurrentEPOC (void) {
00172 #if defined(STACK_USE_SNTP_CLIENT)
00173         char Tempdigit[12];
00174         
00175         uitoa((SNTPGetUTCSeconds() / TICK_SECOND), Tempdigit);
00176         TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, Tempdigit, strlen((char*)Tempdigit));      
00177 #endif
00178 }

00181 //*****************************************************************************
00182 
00183 /// For debug purposes, prints the result code
00184 void HTTPPrint_SNTPTestOutput (void) {
00185         
00186         // Set a flag to indicate not finished
00187         curHTTP.callbackPos = 1;
00188 
00189         // Make sure there's enough output space
00190         if(TCPIsPutReady(sktHTTP) < 15)
00191                 return;
00192         
00193         if (NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_COMPLETED)
00194                 TCPPutROMString(sktHTTP, (ROM BYTE*)"Successful");
00195         else if (NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_DNSERROR)
00196                 TCPPutROMString(sktHTTP, (ROM BYTE*)"DNS error");
00197         else if (NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_ARPERROR)
00198                 TCPPutROMString(sktHTTP, (ROM BYTE*)"ARP error");
00199         else if (NTPTestResponse == NTP_TEST_TIMEOUT)
00200                 TCPPutROMString(sktHTTP, (ROM BYTE*)"Time out");
00201         else 
00202                 TCPPutROMString(sktHTTP, (ROM BYTE*)"Error unkown");
00203         
00204         // Indicate that we're done
00205         curHTTP.callbackPos = 0x00;
00206         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_DONE;
00207         return;         
00208 }

00210 
00211 /*****************************************************************************
00212   Function:
00213         void SNTPClient(void)
00214 
00215   Summary:
00216         Periodically checks the current time from a pool of servers.
00217 
00218   Description:
00219         This function periodically checks a pool of time servers to obtain the
00220         current date/time.
00221 
00222   Precondition:
00223         UDP is initialized.
00224 
00225   Parameters:
00226         None
00227 
00228   Returns:
00229         None
00230         
00231   Remarks:
00232         This function requires once available UDP socket while processing, but
00233         frees that socket when the SNTP module is idle.
00234   ***************************************************************************/
00235 void SNTPClient(void)
00236 {
00237         NTP_PACKET                      pkt;
00238         WORD                            w;
00239         static NODE_INFO        Server;
00240         static DWORD            NTPdwTimer;
00241         static UDP_SOCKET       MySocket;
00242 
00243 
00244 
00245         switch(SNTPState)
00246         {
00247                 case SM_HOME:
00248 
00249 // JN added     next 2 lines                    
00250                         // If encryption is not needed then disable NTP
00251                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00252                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: started...\r\n");
00253                         #endif
00254 
00255 
00256                         if (xPLConfig.Use_AES == FALSE) {
00257                                 NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_TIMEOUT;
00258                                 break;
00259                         }
00260                         
00261                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00262                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: started\r\n");
00263                         #endif
00264                         // Obtain ownership of the DNS resolution module
00265                         if(!DNSBeginUsage())
00266                                 break;
00267 
00268                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00269                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: DNS ownership obtained\r\n");
00270                         #endif
00271                                 
00272 // JN changed next 2 lines
00273                         // Obtain the IP address associated with the server name
00274                         //DNSResolveROM((ROM BYTE*)NTP_SERVER, DNS_TYPE_A);
00275                         DNSResolve((BYTE*) xPLConfig.NTP_Server,  DNS_TYPE_A);
00276                         
00277                         NTPdwTimer = TickGet();
00278                         SNTPState = SM_NAME_RESOLVE;
00279                         break;
00280 
00281                 case SM_NAME_RESOLVE:
00282                         // Wait for DNS resolution to complete
00283                         if(!DNSIsResolved(&Server.IPAddr)) 
00284                         {
00285                                 if((TickGet() - NTPdwTimer) > (5 * TICK_SECOND)) 
00286                                 {
00287                                         DNSEndUsage();
00288                                         NTPdwTimer = TickGetDiv64K();
00289                                         SNTPState = SM_SHORT_WAIT;
00290                                         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_DNSERROR;
00291                                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00292                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: DNS did not resolve in time\r\n");
00293                                         #endif
00294                                 }
00295                                 break;
00296                         }
00297                         
00298                         // Obtain DNS resolution result
00299                         if(!DNSEndUsage())
00300                         {
00301                                 // No valid IP address was returned from the DNS 
00302                                 // server.  Quit and fail for a while if host is not valid.
00303                                 NTPdwTimer = TickGetDiv64K();
00304                                 SNTPState = SM_SHORT_WAIT;
00305                                 NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_DNSERROR;
00306                                 break;
00307                         }
00308                         SNTPState = SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE;
00309                         // No need to break
00310 
00311                 case SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE:
00312                 case SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE2:
00313                 case SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE3:
00314                         // Obtain the MAC address associated with the server's IP address 
00315                         ARPResolve(&Server.IPAddr);
00316                         NTPdwTimer = TickGet();
00317                         SNTPState++;
00318                 
00319                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00320                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: start ARP\r\n");
00321                         #endif
00322                         
00323                         break;
00324 
00325                 case SM_ARP_RESOLVE:
00326                 case SM_ARP_RESOLVE2:
00327                 case SM_ARP_RESOLVE3:
00328                         // Wait for the MAC address to finish being obtained
00329                         if(!ARPIsResolved(&Server.IPAddr, &Server.MACAddr))
00330                         {
00331                                 // Time out if too much time is spent in this state
00332                                 if(TickGet() - NTPdwTimer > 1*TICK_SECOND)
00333                                 {
00334                                         // Retransmit ARP request by going to next SM_ARP_START_RESOLVE state or fail by going to SM_ARP_RESOLVE_FAIL state.
00335                                         SNTPState++;
00336                                 }
00337                                 break;
00338                         }
00339                         SNTPState = SM_UDP_SEND;
00340                         break;
00341 
00342                 case SM_ARP_RESOLVE_FAIL:
00343                         // ARP failed after 3 tries, abort and wait for next time query
00344                         NTPdwTimer = TickGetDiv64K();
00345                         SNTPState = SM_SHORT_WAIT;
00346                         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_ARPERROR;
00347                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00348                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: ARP failed\r\n");
00349                         #endif
00350 
00351                         break;
00352 
00353                 case SM_UDP_SEND:
00354                         // Open up the sending UDP socket
00355                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00356                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: UDP send\r\n");
00357                         #endif
00358                         MySocket = UDPOpen(0, &Server, NTP_SERVER_PORT);
00359                         if(MySocket == INVALID_UDP_SOCKET)
00360                                 break;
00361 
00362                         // Make certain the socket can be written to
00363                         if(!UDPIsPutReady(MySocket))
00364                         {
00365                                 UDPClose(MySocket);
00366                                 break;
00367                         }
00368 
00369                         // Transmit a time request packet
00370                         memset(&pkt, 0, sizeof(pkt));
00371                         pkt.flags.versionNumber = 3;    // NTP Version 3
00372                         pkt.flags.mode = 3;                             // NTP Client
00373                         pkt.orig_ts_secs = swapl(NTP_EPOCH);
00374                         UDPPutArray((BYTE*) &pkt, sizeof(pkt)); 
00375                         UDPFlush();     
00376                         
00377                         NTPdwTimer = TickGet();
00378                         SNTPState = SM_UDP_RECV;                
00379                         break;
00380 
00381                 case SM_UDP_RECV:
00382                         // Look for a response time packet
00383                         if(!UDPIsGetReady(MySocket)) 
00384                         {
00385                                 if((TickGet()) - NTPdwTimer > NTP_REPLY_TIMEOUT)
00386                                 {
00387                                         // Abort the request and wait until the next timeout period
00388                                         UDPClose(MySocket);
00389                                         NTPdwTimer = TickGetDiv64K();
00390                                         SNTPState = SM_SHORT_WAIT;
00391                                         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_TIMEOUT;
00392                                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00393                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: No response\r\n");
00394                                         #endif
00395                                         break;
00396                                 }
00397                                 break;
00398                         }
00399                         
00400                         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00401                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"SNTP: UDP received\r\n");
00402                         #endif
00403                         
00404                         // Get the response time packet
00405                         w = UDPGetArray((BYTE*) &pkt, sizeof(pkt));
00406                         UDPClose(MySocket);
00407                         NTPdwTimer = TickGetDiv64K();
00408                         SNTPState = SM_WAIT;
00409 
00410                         // Validate packet size
00411                         if(w != sizeof(pkt)) 
00412                         {
00413                                 break;  
00414                         }
00415                         
00416                         // Set out local time to match the returned time
00417                         dwLastUpdateTick = TickGet();
00418                         dwSNTPSeconds = swapl(pkt.tx_ts_secs) - NTP_EPOCH;
00419                         // Do rounding.  If the partial seconds is > 0.5 then add 1 to the seconds count.
00420                         if(((BYTE*)&pkt.tx_ts_fraq)[0] & 0x80)
00421                                 dwSNTPSeconds++;
00422 
00423                         break;
00424 
00425                 case SM_SHORT_WAIT:
00426                         // Attempt to requery the NTP server after a specified NTP_FAST_QUERY_INTERVAL time (ex: 8 seconds) has elapsed.
00427                         if(TickGetDiv64K() - NTPdwTimer > (NTP_FAST_QUERY_INTERVAL/65536ull))
00428                                 SNTPState = SM_HOME;    
00429                         break;
00430 
00431                 case SM_WAIT:
00432                         
00433                         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_COMPLETED;
00434                         // Requery the NTP server after a specified NTP_QUERY_INTERVAL time (ex: 10 minutes) has elapsed.
00435                         if(TickGetDiv64K() - NTPdwTimer > (NTP_QUERY_INTERVAL/65536ull))
00436                                 SNTPState = SM_HOME;    
00437 
00438                         break;
00439         }
00440 }
00441 
00442 
00443 /*****************************************************************************
00444   Function:
00445         DWORD SNTPGetUTCSeconds(void)
00446 
00447   Summary:
00448         Obtains the current time from the SNTP module.
00449 
00450   Description:
00451         This function obtains the current time as reported by the SNTP module.  
00452         Use this value for absolute time stamping.  The value returned is (by
00453         default) the number of seconds since 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00.
00454 
00455   Precondition:
00456         None
00457 
00458   Parameters:
00459         None
00460 
00461   Returns:
00462         The number of seconds since the Epoch.  (Default 01-Jan-1970 00:00:00)
00463         
00464   Remarks:
00465         Do not use this function for time difference measurements.  The Tick
00466         module is more appropriate for those requirements.
00467   ***************************************************************************/
00468 DWORD SNTPGetUTCSeconds(void)
00469 {
00470         DWORD dwTickDelta;
00471         DWORD dwTick;
00472 
00473         // Update the dwSNTPSeconds variable with the number of seconds 
00474         // that has elapsed
00475         dwTick = TickGet();
00476         dwTickDelta = dwTick - dwLastUpdateTick;
00477         while(dwTickDelta > TICK_SECOND)
00478         {
00479                 dwSNTPSeconds++;
00480                 dwTickDelta -= TICK_SECOND;
00481         }
00482         
00483         // Save the tick and residual fractional seconds for the next call
00484         dwLastUpdateTick = dwTick - dwTickDelta;
00485 
00486         return dwSNTPSeconds;
00487 }
